name: Centre on Regulation in Europe
goal:
The Centre on Regulation in Europe (CERRE) is a think tank which promotes robust and consistent regulation systems and practices in Europe's network and digital industries through top quality studies, training and dissemination activities.

CERRE's membership structure and its governance are unique. Members include national (and regional) regulatory authorities and operators (which have equal voting rights in the General Assembly and the Board of Directors) as well as universities.

CERRE's activities are guided by scientific excellence and full academic independence, as well as by strategic and political relevance.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Climate Action, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Energy, Information Society, Internal Market, Research and Technology, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
Digital Single Market
Energy Union
Third Railway Package
EU Climate and Energy Package 2030
REFIT of AVMS Directive
ETS Review
